questions: What is Biodiversity ?
answers: Biodiversity is the existence of a wide variety of species of plants, animals and micro-organisms in a natural habitat within a particular environment or of genetic variation within a species.

questions: What are the two kinds of natural resources ?
answers: Water and forest.

questions: Write one negative effect of affluent lifestyle of few persons on the environment.
answers: Exploitation and consumption of natural resources will ultimately result in their scarcity.

questions: How is solar energy is made useful to the living world ?
answers: Plants carry out photosynthesis, which converts the energy of the sun into a form which can be used by the rest of the living world.

questions: What does presence of coliform in water indicate ?
answers: The presence of coliform in water indicates contamination by disease causing micro-organisms.

questions: Name the group of bacteria that confirms the contamination of water.
answers: Coliform.

questions: Give one example each from your daily life where the domestic waste can be effectively reused and recycled.
answers: Reuse : We can reuse the empty bottles of jam, pickles etc. for the storage purposes. Recycle : We can recycle old newspapers, aluminium cans etc.

questions: How does increasing demand for energy adversely affect our environment ?
answers: To meet the increased demand for energy, more and more natural resources are exploited. Pollutants are emitted during exploitation and use of natural resources which affect our environment.
